dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, I heard this story, um, about a guy in Kazakhstan who sings Malaysian anthems. Like, as a hobby.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, I heard this story, um, about a guy in Kazakhstan who sings Malaysian anthems. Like, as a hobby.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An employee of a store in a Malaysian airport unexpectedly sang the national anthem of Kazakhstan for the cameras of surprised tourists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, no, it's uh, kinda the opposite, A. It's a Malaysian dude, in a Malaysian airport, singing the Kazakh national anthem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, no, it's uh, kinda the opposite, A. It's a Malaysian dude, in a Malaysian airport, singing the Kazakh national anthem.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An employee of a store in a Malaysian airport unexpectedly sang the national anthem of Kazakhstan for the cameras of surprised tourists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? A Malaysian guy? In Malaysia? Why would he know, uh, the Kazakh anthem?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? A Malaysian guy? In Malaysia? Why would he know, uh, the Kazakh anthem?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. This Kazakh woman, Asel, she was flying home from Kuala Lumpur. Went into a duty-free shop, showed her passport, and the employee just... started singing their anthem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. This Kazakh woman, Asel, she was flying home from Kuala Lumpur. Went into a duty-free shop, showed her passport, and the employee just... started singing their anthem.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Kazakh woman, Asel, was flying home from the Kuala Lumpur airport in Malaysia. She went into a duty free store and, having shown her passport, unexpectedly heard the employee sing the national anthem of Kazakhstan, performed in a fairly pure Kazakh language.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For real? Like, randomly? And it was, like, good?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For real? Like, randomly? And it was, like, good?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, yeah. In pure Kazakh. She was so surprised, she asked him to sing it again for her camera, and, uh, other passengers came to listen too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, yeah. In pure Kazakh. She was so surprised, she asked him to sing it again for her camera, and, uh, other passengers came to listen too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Then I asked him to sing it for the camera, and three more passengers came to listen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. But, like, how? Did he live there? Was he, you know, a spy or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. But, like, how? Did he live there? Was he, you know, a spy or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, he, um, hasn't even been to Kazakhstan. His name's Azizi Zamhari, he's 34.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, he, um, hasn't even been to Kazakhstan. His name's Azizi Zamhari, he's thirty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Later, after questioning the man, the tourist found out that he was 34 years old and his name was Azizi Zamhari. He is a citizen of Malaysia and has never been to Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A hobby? To learn, like, national anthems?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A hobby? To learn, like, national anthems?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. Since he was 15, actually. He learns them from YouTube, he said. He knows 45 of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. Since he was fifteen, actually. He learns them from YouTube, he said. He knows forty five of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My passion since I was 15 is to learn foreign national anthems. ... I asked him how he knew our anthem, and he said that he learned it from YouTube. ... He said that he knows 45 anthems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Forty-five? That's insane. Does he just, like, sing them to everyone?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forty-five? That's insane. Does he just, like, sing them to everyone?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he does sing them to customers sometimes. He says it, uh, helps make a good impression and builds relationships. Like, strengthens ties between countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he does sing them to customers sometimes. He says it, uh, helps make a good impression and builds relationships. Like, strengthens ties between countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sometimes I sing them to customers, it helps me make a good impression and provide good service to my customers, in addition to strengthening good relations between countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's, uh, a unique customer service approach, I guess. Did he know anything else about Kazakhstan?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, uh, a unique customer service approach, I guess. Did he know anything else about Kazakhstan?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. He's really into their culture. He knows Kazakh cuisine, like beshbarmak and plov. He even said his favorite beshbarmak is, um, with horse meat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah. He's really into their culture. He knows Kazakh cuisine, like beshbarmak and plov. He even said his favorite beshbarmak is, um, with horse meat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also said that he knows Kazakh cuisine and has tried it. He especially liked beshbarmak and plov. ... My favorite Kazakh food is beshbarmak with horse meat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Horse meat? Wow. So he's, like, properly researched it then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Horse meat? Wow. So he's, like, properly researched it then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. He reads a lot about the country's history and politics. And, you know, he's listened to their singer, Dimash Kudaibergen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. He reads a lot about the country's history and politics. And, you know, he's listened to their singer, Dimash Kudaibergen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The employee also said that he read a lot about Kazakhstan, about the history, politics and cuisine of our country. 'I also listened to Dimash Kudaibergen when he performed with our main diva Siti Nurhaliza.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, he's just really dedicated to this hobby. Does he want to, like, visit Kazakhstan?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, he's just really dedicated to this hobby. Does he want to, like, visit Kazakhstan?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. He really wants to go, try more food, see the markets, the mountains. There are direct flights to Almaty, he hopes to go one day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. He really wants to go, try more food, see the markets, the mountains. There are direct flights to Almaty, he hopes to go one day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I will definitely visit Kazakhstan one day. Firstly, I want to try and enjoy Kazakh food (especially horse meat dishes). Secondly, I want to get to know Kazakh culture (especially Kazakh markets) and architecture. I also want to see the beautiful mountains there. We have direct flights to Almaty, and I would like to fly there one day,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's, um, actually pretty wholesome. From a random duty-free singing moment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's, um, actually pretty wholesome. From a random duty-free singing moment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, you know, it's a cool way to, like, appreciate different cultures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, you know, it's a cool way to, like, appreciate different cultures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I guess so. I just, uh, wouldn't expect that from a sweets and perfume guy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess so. I just, uh, wouldn't expect that from a sweets and perfume guy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has been working as a sales consultant in a duty-free shop for three years, selling sweets and toys, sometimes perfumes and cosmetics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, you never know, right? What passions people have.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, you never know, right? What passions people have.
